entry.title: Advanced SQL course || SQL tutorial advanced

media:group.media:title: Advanced SQL course || SQL tutorial advanced
media:group.media:description: SQL or "sequel"; Structured Query Language) is a domain-specific language used in programming and designed for managing data held in a relational database management system (RDBMS), or for stream processing in a relational data stream management system (RDSMS). It is particularly useful in handling structured data, data incorporating relations among entities and variables. In this #sql course you will learn the advanced syntax or query.

entry.title: Algebra for beginners || Basics of Algebra

media:group.media:title: Algebra for beginners || Basics of Algebra
media:group.media:description: In this course you will learn about algebra which is ideal for absolute beginners. #Algebra is the branch of mathematics that helps in the representation of problems or situations in the form of mathematical expressions. It involves variables like x, y, z, and mathematical operations like addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division to form a meaningful mathematical expression.

media:group.media:title: Trigonometry
media:group.media:description: #shorts Trigonometry is a branch of mathematics that studies relationships between side lengths and angles of triangles.

media:group.media:title: Trigonometry for Beginners || Trigonometry Basics
media:group.media:description: Trigonometry is a branch of mathematics that studies relationships between side lengths and angles of triangles. This math video tutorial provides a basic introduction into #trigonometry. It covers trigonometric functions, ratios such as sine, cosine, and tangent, converting polar coordinate, trigonometry quadrant and vector . This video contains useful trigonometry lessons for beginners.

entry.title: Introduction to Computer Programming for beginners || Coding for beginners

media:group.media:title: Introduction to Computer Programming for beginners || Coding for beginners
media:group.media:description:
Computer programming is the process of performing a particular computation (or more generally, accomplishing a specific computing result), usually by designing and building an executable computer program. Programming involves tasks such as analysis, generating algorithms, profiling algorithms' accuracy and resource consumption, and the implementation of algorithms (usually in a chosen programming language, commonly referred to as #coding). In this course you will learn what is computer #programming all about and learn how to program comprehensively.
‚≠êÔ∏è Join Us ‚≠êÔ∏è Join our FB Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/cslesson Like our FB Page: https://www.facebook.com/cslesson/ Website: https://cslesson.org

media:group.media:title: Virtual Machine Full Course
media:group.media:description:
In computing, a virtual machine (VM) is the virtualization/emulation of a computer system. Virtual machines are based on computer architectures and provide functionality of a physical computer. Their implementations may involve specialized hardware, software, or a combination. In this #virtual_machine course you will learn about the following topics.
‚≠êÔ∏è Table of Content ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚å®Ô∏è (0:00) Introduction to virtual machine ‚å®Ô∏è (2:26) Importing virtual machine into virtual box ‚å®Ô∏è (5:14) Stopping a VM ‚å®Ô∏è (7:19) Resizing the user interface ‚å®Ô∏è (9:59) Keyboard configuration of a VM ‚å®Ô∏è (11:31) Networking between host and VM ‚å®Ô∏è (16:01) VM hardware configuration ‚å®Ô∏è (18:37) Setting up APACHE2 in #VM ‚å®Ô∏è (25:17) Serving website with VM APACHE2 ‚å®Ô∏è (31:47) Setting up PHP in VM ‚å®Ô∏è (41:43) Creating a RESTFUL API backend in VM

media:group.media:title: Linear algebra full course
media:group.media:description:
Linear algebra is central to almost all areas of mathematics. For instance, linear algebra is fundamental in modern presentations of geometry, including for defining basic objects such as lines, planes and rotations. Also, functional analysis, a branch of mathematical analysis, may be viewed as the application of linear algebra to spaces of functions. The following topics of linear algebra have been presented in this video.
‚≠êÔ∏è Table of Contents ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚å®Ô∏è (0:00:00)

entry.title: Quantum Physics Full Course | Quantum Mechanics Course

media:group.media:title: Quantum Physics Full Course | Quantum Mechanics Course
media:group.media:description:
Quantum physics also known as Quantum mechanics is a fundamental theory in physics that provides a description of the physical properties of nature at the scale of atoms and subatomic particles. It is the foundation of all #quantum #physics including quantum chemistry, quantum field theory, quantum technology, and quantum information science.
In this course you will learn about Quantum #mechanics from the beginning to the end. The following topics of Quantum mechanics have been discussed in this course:
‚≠êÔ∏è Table of Contents ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚å®Ô∏è (0:00:00) Introduction to quantum mechanics ‚å®Ô∏è (0:16:23) The domain of quantum mechanics ‚å®Ô∏è (0:24:18) Key concepts of quantum mechanics ‚å®Ô∏è (0:34:04) A review of complex numbers for QM ‚å®Ô∏è (0:48:12) Examples of complex numbers ‚å®Ô∏è (1:01:47) Probability in quantum mechanics ‚å®Ô∏è (1:12:17) Variance of probability distribution ‚å®Ô∏è (1:26:16) Normalization of wave function ‚å®Ô∏è (1:51:47) Position, velocity and momentum from the wave function ‚å®Ô∏è (2:10:59) Introduction to the uncertainty principle ‚å®Ô∏è (2:24:32) Key concepts of QM - revisited ‚å®Ô∏è (2:37:45) Separation of variables and Schrodinger equation ‚å®Ô∏è (3:09:55) Stationary solutions to the Schrodinger equation ‚å®Ô∏è (3:15:47) Superposition of stationary states ‚å®Ô∏è (3:25:37) Potential function in the Schrodinger equation ‚å®Ô∏è (3:48:10) Infinite square well (particle in a box) ‚å®Ô∏è (4:00:58) Infinite square well states, orthogonality - Fourier series ‚å®Ô∏è (4:08:07) Infinite square well example - computation and simulation ‚å®Ô∏è (4:39:27) Quantum harmonic oscillators via ladder operators ‚å®Ô∏è (5:16:48) Quantum harmonic oscillators via power series ‚å®Ô∏è (5:28:32) Free particles and Schrodinger equation ‚å®Ô∏è (5:34:37) Free particles wave packets and stationary states ‚å®Ô∏è (6:10:33) Free particle wave packet example ‚å®Ô∏è (6:13:43) The Dirac delta function ‚å®Ô∏è (6:20:49) Boundary conditions in the time independent Schrodinger equation ‚å®Ô∏è (6:24:39) The bound state solution to the delta function potential TISE ‚å®Ô∏è (6:43:29) Scattering delta function potential ‚å®Ô∏è (6:55:49) Finite square well scattering states ‚å®Ô∏è (7:07:39) Linear algebra introduction for quantum mechanics ‚å®Ô∏è (7:10:34) Linear transformation ‚å®Ô∏è (7:13:04) Mathematical formalism is Quantum mechanics ‚å®Ô∏è (7:37:52) Hermitian operator eigen-stuff ‚å®Ô∏è (8:01:23) Statistics in formalized quantum mechanics ‚å®Ô∏è (8:24:26) Generalized uncertainty principle ‚å®Ô∏è (8:54:36) Energy time uncertainty ‚å®Ô∏è (9:16:33) Schrodinger equation in 3d ‚å®Ô∏è (9:19:56) Hydrogen spectrum ‚å®Ô∏è (9:31:14) Angular momentum operator algebra ‚å®Ô∏è (9:57:17) Angular momentum eigen function ‚å®Ô∏è (10:18:08) Spin in quantum mechanics ‚å®Ô∏è (10:22:23) Two particles system ‚å®Ô∏è (10:58:03) Free electrons in conductors ‚å®Ô∏è (11:09:23) Band structure of energy levels in solids
‚≠êÔ∏è Credit ‚≠êÔ∏è Course Author: Brant Carlson Website: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCNIEAv633WRg4ubBIhOcwMg

media:group.media:title: String Theory Overview
media:group.media:description:
In physics, string theory is a theoretical framework in which the point-like particles of particle physics are replaced by one-dimensional objects called strings. String theory describes how these strings propagate through space and interact with each other. On distance scales larger than the string scale, a string looks just like an ordinary particle, with its mass, charge, and other properties determined by the vibrational state of the string. In string theory, one of the many vibrational states of the string corresponds to the graviton, a quantum mechanical particle that carries gravitational force. Thus string theory is a theory of quantum gravity. #stringtheory
‚≠êÔ∏è Table of Contents ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚å®Ô∏è (0:00:00) Why string theory ‚å®Ô∏è (0:09:57) Classical string theory ‚å®Ô∏è (0:22:34) Quantum string theory
‚≠êÔ∏è Credit ‚≠êÔ∏è Course Author by: Prof. Marcus Berg Website: https://www.youtube.com/user/marcusbergmovie/about

media:group.media:title: Calculus 2
media:group.media:description:
Calculus, originally called infinitesimal calculus or "the calculus of infinitesimals", is the mathematical study of continuous change, in the same way that geometry is the study of shape and algebra is the study of generalizations of arithmetic operations.
This course is about calculus 2. In this course you will learn the following topics: ‚≠êÔ∏è Table of Contents ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚å®Ô∏è (0:00:00) Direction field and Euler's method ‚å®Ô∏è (0:18:18) Linear Equation ‚å®Ô∏è (0:37:24) Predator-prey system ‚å®Ô∏è (0:52:30) Sequences ‚å®Ô∏è (2:20:18) Series ‚å®Ô∏è (2:55:59) The integral test ‚å®Ô∏è (3:26:38) Comparison test ‚å®Ô∏è (3:50:16) Alternating series ‚å®Ô∏è (4:13:27) Absolute convergence and the ratio and root tests ‚å®Ô∏è (4:41:05) Strategy for testing series ‚å®Ô∏è (4:48:35) Power series ‚å®Ô∏è (5:11:35) Tylor and Maclaurin series
‚≠êÔ∏è Credit ‚≠êÔ∏è Course Author by: Kamuela Yong Website: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZ5JattaBe47AndeZxhAFjA/featured

entry.title: SPSS Tutorial for data analysis | SPSS for Beginners | Part 2

media:group.media:title: SPSS Tutorial for data analysis | SPSS for Beginners | Part 2
media:group.media:description:
SPSS Statistics is a software package used for interactive, or batched, statistical analysis. Long produced by SPSS Inc., it was acquired by IBM in 2009. The current versions are named IBM SPSS Statistics. In this course you will how to use SPSS for data analysis. This #SPSS course is beginner friendly.
‚≠ê Table of Contents‚≠ê ‚å®Ô∏è (0:00:00) Assessing normality with SPSS ‚å®Ô∏è (0:04:08) Calculating KR20 reliability coefficient in SPSS ‚å®Ô∏è (0:05:37) Intra class coefficient in SPSS ‚å®Ô∏è (0:07:58) Calculating weighted kappa in SPSS ‚å®Ô∏è (0:11:10) Binary logistic regression in SPSS ‚å®Ô∏è (0:20:41) Interpreting Pearson's product moment correlation in SPSS ‚å®Ô∏è (0:03:30) ANCOVA in SPSS ‚å®Ô∏è (0:26:34) Bivariate regression in SPSS ‚å®Ô∏è (0:33:27) Interpreting chi-square in SPSS ‚å®Ô∏è (0:42:07) Two way anova in SPSS ‚å®Ô∏è (0:47:17) Multiple logistic regression in SPSS ‚å®Ô∏è (0:54:38) Kruskal-wallis one way anova in SPSS ‚å®Ô∏è (0:56:14) U-test in SPSS ‚å®Ô∏è (0:59:19) Multinomial logistic regression in SPSS ‚å®Ô∏è (1:03:00) T-test in SPSS ‚å®Ô∏è (1:11:06) Paired sample t-test ‚å®Ô∏è (1:14:03) Interpreting result of principal components analysis ‚å®Ô∏è (1:35:40) Principal axis factoring ‚å®Ô∏è (1:45:00) Running hierarchical binary logistic regression ‚å®Ô∏è (2:26:00) Running ordinal regression

media:group.media:description:
LaTeX is a high-quality typesetting system; it includes features designed for the production of technical and scientific documentation. LaTeX is the de facto standard for the communication and publication of scientific documents. #LaTeX‚Äã is available as free software.

entry.title: Biostatistics Tutorial Full course for Beginners to Experts

media:group.media:title: Biostatistics Tutorial Full course for Beginners to Experts
media:group.media:description:
Biostatistics are the development and application of statistical methods to a wide range of topics in biology. It encompasses the design of biological experiments, the collection and analysis of data from those experiments and the interpretation of the results.
The following topics of #biostatistics have been discussed in this course ‚≠êÔ∏è Table of Content ‚≠êÔ∏è 0:00 Module 1 - Introduction to Statistics 29:13 Module 2 - Describing Data: Shape 45:44 Module 3 - Describing Data: Central Tendency 1:03:34 Module 4 - Describing Data: Variability 1:34:51 Module 5 - Describing Data: Z-scores 1:43:25 Module 6 - Probability (part I) 2:09:21 Module 6 - Probability (part II) 2:26:22 Module 7 - Distribution of Sample Means 2:41:24 Module 9 - Estimation & Confidence Intervals & Effect Size 2:56:59 Module 10 - Misleading with Statistics 3:17:43 Module 11 - Biostatistics in Medical Decision-making 4:13:36 Module 11b - Biostatistics in Medical Decision-Making: Clinical Application 4:56:51 Module 12 - Biostatistics in Epidemiology 5:05:16 Module 13 - Asking Questions: Research Study Design 5:10:15 Module 14 - Bias & Confounders 5:39:20 Module 16 - Correlation & Regression 6:06:19 Module 17 - Non-parametric Tests
‚≠êÔ∏è Credit‚≠ê Creator: Quinnipiac University: Health Professions Biostatistics License: Creative Commons Attribution license (reuse allowed)

media:group.media:title: Physical chemistry
media:group.media:description:
Physical chemistry is the study of macroscopic, and particulate phenomena in chemical systems in terms of the principles, practices, and concepts of physics such as motion, energy, force, time, #thermodynamics, #quantum chemistry, #statistical mechanics, analytical dynamics and chemical equilibrium.
#PhysicalChemistry, in contrast to chemical physics, is predominantly (but not always) a macroscopic or supra-molecular science, as the majority of the principles on which it was founded relate to the bulk rather than the molecular/atomic structure alone (for example, chemical equilibrium and colloids). (Source: wikipedia)
This is the full course of Physical chemistry where the following topics have been discussed in a very comprehensive way.

entry.title: Data Science with Python Course for Beginners | Python Machine Learning | Data Analysis with Python

media:group.media:title: Data Science with Python Course for Beginners | Python Machine Learning | Data Analysis with Python
media:group.media:description:
Data science with Python course will teach you almost every thing you need to know in order to Analyze #data and to build machine learning model. First part of this course will teach you about #Python programming and then it will deep dive into Pandas, matplotlib, #scikit-learn to teach you about data analysis and #machinelearning. This Data science with python course has been designed for absolute #beginners. Hence no pre-requisite is required.
‚≠êÔ∏è Download Anaconda: https://www.anaconda.com/products/individual
‚≠êÔ∏è Table of Contents‚≠êÔ∏è
0:00 Beginning Python - learn Python programming from scratch 1:55:08 Intermediate Python programming: Modules, classes, Exceptions 3:33:20 Introduction data analysis with Python 5:30:40 Applied data analysis in Python: Machine learning and #DataScience
üìù The course material is freely available at https://milliams.com/courses/ Feel free to follow along!
